author: Christina W
title: Small but Nice
text:
Our family loved this hotel for the location and friendly, helpful staff. We stayed here while touring schools in the New York area. The front desk staff was exceptionally helpful in recommending restaurants and reserving a car to go outside the City and giving directions to various site seeing locations. The breakfast was a "huge" surprise meaning it was delicious and the portions are huge! The atmosphere of the lobby, bar, and restaurant is very current and we loved the décor. Guests (and I believe locals) enjoyed the complimentary wine hour. The only downside to this hotel was the tiny room. The décor and amenities are good, but there was no drawer space to put our clothes (only closet space for hanging items). We all had to live out of our suitcases for the week. Check the square footage before staying. The bed takes up all of the room. There was a long hallway to get to the bedroom and sitting area, but it wasn't useful for living space. One thing I appreciated was the hardwood floors, which eliminated the "yuck carpet" factor you get in most hotels. We would definitely stay here again since we also liked the close proximity to Penn Station.
